newsitem.title: UK: British Labour Party increases opinion poll lead.
newsitem.headline: British Labour Party increases opinion poll lead.

text.p: Britain's opposition Labour Party has increased its lead over the ruling Conservatives, according to an opinion survey published on Tuesday.

An ICM poll for the Guardian shows Labour on 48 percent, unchanged from a month earlier, while Conservative support has slipped by two points to 30 percent. Backing for the Liberal Democrats is up one point to 16 percent.

The survey was compiled after Labour's crushing victory in a by-election for the seat of Wirral South last week, the last test of public opinion before the general election expected to be held on May 1.
But in Scotland, Labour's support has slipped by six points to 46 percent, according to a System Three poll for The Herald newspaper.
The Scottish National Party gained one point to 26 percent, the Conservatives rose one point to 16 percent and the Liberal Democrats put on two points to rise to 10 percent.
